sentences.sContent: His daughter, Louise, is by now a college sophomore.
sentences.sContent_eng: His daughter, Louise, is by now a college sophomore.
sentences.sCn: 他的女儿，路易斯，现在是大学二年级学生。

sentences.sContent: I'd been in television since I was 19 and a sophomore.
sentences.sContent_eng: I'd been in television since I was 19 and a sophomore.
sentences.sCn: 我在19岁还是大学二年级的时候就已经上了电视。

sentences.sContent: It was June 2001, and just the thought of causing any more pain to 20-year-old Michael, a college sophomore diagnosed a few months earlier with a rare form of leukemia, made her anxious.
sentences.sContent_eng: It was June 2001, and just the thought of causing any more pain to 20-year-old Michael, a college sophomore diagnosed a few months earlier with a rare form of leukemia, made her anxious.
sentences.sCn: 那是在2001年六月，20岁的迈克尔是一所大学二年级的学生，几个月前他被查出患了一种罕见的白血病。 一想到又要给儿子增加痛苦她就感到不安。

words.tran: 复杂的；精致的；久经世故的；富有经验的
使变得世故；使迷惑；篡改（sophisticate的过去分词形式）

trans.tranCn: 大学二年级生；（美）有二年经验的人
trans.tranOther: a student who is in their second year of study at a college or  high school

trans.tranCn: 二年级的；二年级学生的
